meanings.definition: Unable to be expressed in words.
meanings.sent1: The beauty of the sunset was truly inexpressible.
meanings.sent2: Her joy at seeing her family after so long was inexpressible.
meanings.sent3: The cat's inexpressible attempt at meowing made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The inexpressible love between the couple was evident in their eyes.
meanings.sent5: The pain of losing a loved one is truly inexpressible.

meanings.definition: Too great or intense to be described.
meanings.sent1: The inexpressible power of the storm left a trail of destruction.
meanings.sent2: The inexpressible heat of the desert made it unbearable to walk outside.
meanings.sent3: The inexpressible size of the cake made everyone's eyes widen in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The inexpressible excitement of the crowd filled the stadium with energy.
meanings.sent5: The inexpressible fear in her eyes told a story of its own.
